textPlain: It's interesting that he signs off with "So long, and thanks for all the fish," which is a quote from The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy:Just before the Vogons demolish Earth to make way for a hyperspace bypass, the dolphins, knowing what’s coming, leave the planet and their farewell message is “So long, and thanks for all the fish.”I wonder what he's implying about GitHub…
Without checking the article… do you know the name of who write the article?
Leaving some nice words behind while leaving the AI-infested shithole...
>guiding us into the age of Copilot and AI, it has been the ride of a lifetime.Cool. Can we get faster load times on that mess of a SPA now instead of more AI stuff?
> I wonder what he's implying about GitHubNothing. It's just a common(-ish) reference/joke.
> I wonder what he's implying about GitHub…Don't forget to carry a towel at all times, of course!
It's also a common goodbye message from "cool people" lol, I won't read too much into it.

The reference likely hints at GitHub's transformation under Microsoft - the dolphins (Thomas and team) foresaw changes coming (AI integration and corporate direction) and are gracefully departing before the "demolition" of what GitHub originally stood for.
